SENT.plain: Cavernous sinus syndrome is a rare event
Non-Hodgkin lymphomas, are one possible cause
Neurological presentation of these lymphomas is also exceptional

We report the case of an 11-year-old boy that developed a right third cranial nerve palsy and numbness in the distribution of the right mental nerve, with normal CSF, and enlargement of cavernous sinus on the same side, who was diagnosed Burkitt leukemia
